description: User receives a personalized 6‑week sprint‑training plan to improve 5K time, with interval sessions and recovery days, generated after the coach fetches recent fitness data and checks medical guidelines.

messages.content: You are VitalFit Coach, an agentic LLM that assists users with personalized fitness and nutrition plans using the available tools.
Hey VitalFit, I want a sprint‑training plan to shave a few minutes off my 5K time. I have a week of recent tracker data. Can you design something with interval sessions and proper recovery days?
Sure! I’ll first pull your recent fitness data and verify any relevant medical guidelines before building the plan.
{"guidelines": "No contraindications for high‑intensity interval training found for the provided conditions."}

Great, I’ve got your recent activity stats and confirmed there are no medical restrictions. I’ll now generate a 6‑week sprint‑training plan that mixes interval sessions, tempo runs, easy runs, and recovery days.

{"plan": "Week 1
Mon: Easy Run 5 km (zone 2)
Tue: Interval – 6×400 m at 5K race pace, 90 s jog recovery
Wed: Rest or gentle yoga
Thu: Tempo Run 6 km at slightly below lactate threshold (≈85% max HR)
Fri: Easy Run 4 km + strides (4×100 m)
Sat: Long Run 10 km easy pace
Sun: Rest

Week 2
Mon: Easy Run 5 km
Tue: Interval – 5×800 m at 5K pace, 2 min jog recovery
Wed: Cross‑train (bike 45 min low intensity)
Thu: Tempo Run 7 km
Fri: Easy Run 5 km + strides
Sat: Long Run 12 km easy
Sun: Rest

Week 3 (Recovery week)
Mon: Easy Run 4 km
Tue: Light Interval – 4×400 m at 5K pace, 2 min jog
Wed: Rest
Thu: Easy Run 5 km
Fri: Cross‑train 30 min
Sat: Long Run 9 km easy
Sun: Rest

Week 4
Mon: Easy Run 5 km
Tue: Interval – 6×800 m at race pace, 2 min jog
Wed: Rest or yoga
Thu: Tempo Run 8 km
Fri: Easy Run 5 km + strides
Sat: Long Run 14 km
Sun: Rest

Week 5
Mon: Easy Run 5 km
Tue: Interval – 4×1200 m at 5K pace, 3 min jog
Wed: Cross‑train 45 min
Thu: Tempo Run 9 km
Fri: Easy Run 5 km + strides
Sat: Long Run 12 km easy
Sun: Rest

Week 6 (Taper)
Mon: Easy Run 4 km
Tue: Interval – 3×400 m fast, full recovery
Wed: Rest
Thu: Easy Run 3 km
Fri: Rest
Sat: 5K race day – aim for target time!
Sun: Recovery walk or gentle stretch

Key notes:
- Warm‑up 10‑15 min before every hard session.
- Cool‑down 5‑10 min plus stretching.
- Keep average sleep ≥7 h/night to aid recovery.
- If you feel excessive fatigue, replace a hard day with an easy run or rest."}

Here’s your 6‑week sprint‑training plan designed to improve your 5K time. It alternates high‑intensity interval sessions with tempo runs, easy runs, and dedicated recovery days. Follow the weekly schedule, maintain good sleep (at least 7 hours per night), and stay hydrated. Let me know if you’d like adjustments for any upcoming events or if you want a nutrition plan to complement the training!
